snippet: Tehran’s granting of a prison visit to Imam Mohammad Ali Elahi suggested that Amir Hekmati, a Marine veteran held since 2011, might be released soon.
abstract: American cleric Imam Mohammad Ali Elahi says in interview that he was allowed to visit Marine veteran Amir Hekmati, longest-held American prisoner in Iran, during his visit to country; usually Iran only permits immediate relatives to visit prisoners, suggesting that Hekmati may be released soon.
lead_paragraph: Tehran’s granting of a prison visit to Imam Mohammad Ali Elahi suggested that Amir Hekmati, a Marine veteran held since 2011, might be released soon.

headline.main: Michigan Imam Visits Amir Hekmati, Longest-Held American in Iran
headline.print_headline: American Held in Iran Is Allowed a Rare Visit
